DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary testicular carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Clinical T Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation. The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/22/19 Transferred context from Test to NCI Standards and edited for AJCC Ed 8 content; tmt.  Created in error. The extent of primary tumor is usually classified after radical orchiectomy and, for this reason, a pathologic stage is assigned.  mc 1/31/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which the tumor invades scrotum with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which the tumor invades scrotum with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with a finding of germ cell neoplasia in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with a finding of germ cell neoplasia in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer cTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer cTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer cTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer Clinical TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
